lines.text:
[Thatcher is dining out with her Cabinet]
Would you like to order, Sir?
Steak, please.
How would you like it?
Raw
And what about the vegetables?
Oh? They'll have the same as me...

[Interviewing Tony Blair]
Mr. Blair I put it to you if you were Prime Minister, if you are Prime Minister, what would you do?
Well under a Labour govermont of course, we would spend money on education, the health service and roads. We will also charge less money for tax and that is what the Labour Party is all about
A nice decision but how will you pay for it?
Well it will be a happy society, where pensioners are paid more, benefits are higer and we will be shinny happy people holding hand and that is what the Labour Party is all about.
Mr. Blair, I must insist how will you pay for it?
Well it will be a land of Milk and Honey, where there will be trees of plenty and a garden of paradise and that is what the Labour Party is all about.
PAY FOR IT WILL YOU HOW?
Oh, well that's an interesting question Brian there is a lot of ways we can find the money.
How?
Well we can look down the sofa for a start.
Mr. Blair I put it to you that you have nothing to back up your policies?
Well it is funny you should ask that Brian, because having nothing to back up your policies thats is...
What the Labour Party is all about.
Exactly... No!
My Father was in the Circus, you know.

[end of program]
And now, back to the puppets...
Oh, you were lucky if you could get cheese in my day! You had to make do with a blanket folded sides-to-mittle!
I'll sides-to-middle her in a minute!

[Royal Variety Show]
I hate the theatre! There's always some dreadful old man explaining what's happening to his family...
War is Horrible/ I love Lin-da/ Black people are the same as White People/ Except they're Black/ Let's all go and live in Scotland/ Singing La-la-la-la-la-lack.
